reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall, I would say this is an excellent pre-alpha game. A lot of the game mechanics are intuative and fun. The combat can be dynamic, and there can be excellent elements of teamplay and co-operation. The player community is generally helpful and understanding towards newer players. The bans handed out by the chat mods are, on the most part, entirely fair and justified. The game dev has done an excellent job creating a fun, playable, game that is addictive and compelling once you get into it.

However there is a flip side to this. As good as the game itself is, the admin community is appauling. Myself and multiple other players felt forced to quit the game after allegations of cheating were publicly raised against us by the Admin team. After days of fighting in the forums it turned out that there was no evidence to support these claims and they were withdrawn by the Developer.

The gameplay can be repetative and grindy, as with any crafting game, however if you use teamwork and set personal goals then the time flies by. As the game is still pre-alpha it does not hold your hand, but expects you to hit the ground running.

In summary, this is an excellent pre-alpha game with great potential, but with a heavy handed over zealous admin staff. Until both the game and the Admin community has further improved I recommend that you tread very lightly, and think hard before investing any real money into the game.

Well, glad I've waited until now to write this review. In the past I have defended the actions of the moderators of this game and have told players that if they keep their heads down and not stir the pot they wouldn't be targeted by mods for no reason, but it appears as though I was gravely mistaken.

After playing for quite some time now, the clan that I was a part of was mistakenly targeted by the moderators for using bots to harvest resources.

The logs showed breaks where the player had stepped away from the computer for given amounts of time to get something to eat, or to take a bathroom break. Not something that bots are known for doing.

My warning to you new players interested in playing this game is to not bother buying the premium because you're likely to lose any money you invest. Be prepared to spend long hours grinding out resources and high scores only to have them dumped into the abyss.

Biggest waste of my time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Long and short it is a boring game that needs to be easier on those who want to join.

The largest sin this game has is being dull and poorly planned. To help illustrate this I will tell my story.

Read reviews most complaints about Admins okay so don't use that chat fine that can be overcome with some ease. So download boot up game... Why am i in a desert? That is the first problem you surround a person with literal nothing... okay fine i can work with this. interact with sand... nope need a shovel. Okay fine i'll get a shovel. Walk a short distance. Find work bench okay what do i need to make a shovel... There is no shovel option. So now the only thing I can interact with is a bench and the ground... and no way to interact with the ground. Fine i can do this keep walking. Cactus I can do something with that if I have an ax. I remember seeing an ax. Go back open menu for crafting I need sticks, large rock, and wood fibers? okay fine. lets find a tree. 10 minute walk. I found A tree okay fine I'll grab some twigs. Walk some more see a rock. lets gather large rock. Get 5 small rocks and 1 average rock. THERE ARE NO OTHER ROCKS. okay fine well lets figure out this wood fiber thing. needs sticks and small rocks and about 20 of them each. Well hey look i got some research points lets spend them on something. Clothes would be nice. What does it take to make those. A LOT OF RESOURCES
See the problem its a walking simulator with some gathering inbetween, but its not fun. The tools to make it fun are behind the scarce resources I need to find. but If thats what it takes then whats the game about.
At first i thought it was a cheap minecraft ripoff which, I'll admit, I would not mind but there is a key difference between the two games.
In minecraft I can be dropped in a desert but I can do things Dig sand and often resources can be found to do things with. Here I need to put in I would guess about two hours before i got the basic tools. MC about 10 minutes to get the basic tools I could have a small farm and a mud hut in MC in the time it would take me to get the basic tools in this game. I don't mind working for something. I enjoy setting a goal for myself, but when the goal provides no other challenge than to walk in a straite line until you luck upon what you need to get started on the most basic items, then is it a challenge or bad game design?

This game is not easy.
It is fairly simple. Not a lot of complicated things to learn/read.
However, If you're looking for an easy game, THIS GAME IS NOT EASY.
You will start of completely and utterly useless.
It will take hours of play-time collecting resources before you're able to progress.

You must walk a far distance to find resources, because everything is semi-finite. All of the resources respawn, but not very quickly. If an area is heavily populated.. it's going to get picked clean and most likely stay that way. you need to expand and walk to new areas.

The battle system in this game is epic. It's a LOT of fun, but it's also very difficult. You start off very weak, and mostly everything will kill you. However, you have a brain. The bots are following code. You can manipulate them in ways that will help you win.

A lot of the reviews here on steam are criticizing the chat moderators. These people are mostly just trying to keep the chat some-what civilized. No cussing, no flaming,don't insult the game or other people, DO NOT TALK IN ALL CAPS, do not spam. 100% of the people who were banned did one of those things. Most of the people that are complaining barely made it into the game, because they just started off with WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥ DO I DO?????".

I don't understand the hate this game gets.
I joined the game expecting a very bad game, with bad people, and bad machanics and UI. what i got was a very fun game, the nicest and most helpful people i've seen in a game in years, and very fair yet tough game play, and a desent UI. I also learned that most of the reviews are straight complaining about things that were their own fault.
I'm going to run through a list of the most common complaints and explain why they are bias.

-Again this is a list of things that aren't wrong with the game-

-Bad Graphics: this is basically minecraft style graphics right. what did you honestly expect. And graphics aren't even the focus of this game.

-There are no resources on the map: this is flat out false. there are so many resources that they are constantly in the way when walking around. the problem is because people who spawn in refuse to walk 3 feet in any direction and mine up all the resources directly at spawn.

-The Map is too big: its 2050 blocks by 2050 blocks. while it sounds big, its not. think of this in minecraft terms. 2000 blocks is tiny.

-It takes too long to travel: I've walked the entire edge of the map and it only took just over an hour. you should never have to walk that far or that long. there's no reason too.

-The enemys are too hard: you can't be attacked by enemys until level 5 which takes a while. I have 200 hours in the game and my character is level 7. you also have plenty of time to gear up before level 5, and even then they don't agro that often.

-Players attack other players: you are given 30 seconds to turn down an attack made on you by a player, and a giant popup appears in the middle of the screen. if you get attacked you must have been afk, in which case isn't any different then any other game out there.

-Admin's are out of control: From what i've seen they should be banning twice as many people. There are constantly tons of spammers and rude dudes in chat that get told off. they rarely get banned, and only are when they start insulting and threatining others. And I've seen a few people get banned, who deserved to, then go and make a negative review twisting what happened out of revenge.

-Banned in chat: so what? why does getting banned from the puplic chat matter? how does that effect you playing the game? they never ban people for asking for help. if all you needed the chat for was asking for help you shouldn't be banned. if you are spamming in the public chat things that don't help others and get banned, you only have your self to blame.

-Pay to win: Not at all. I personally see no reason to buy boosts. maybe if you wanted to jump right into mid or end game buying stuff would help. but why would you want to do that? You could buy a little to upgrade your base if you wanted, but there's no need to. its super easy to get most things with little to no time.

-No tutorial: it actually does have one... not sure what else to say about this...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fair warning to those who decide to get this game. You will not be able to connect at all some days, but when you do connect you'll find a decent game though it dose need ALOT of work. Tutorial was broken for me, but I still was able to learn how to play, so get this game if you don't mind a half way decent game for its curret stage, and don't mind not being able to join 24/7, then this game might be worth trying.  Also servers are unstable if you find your self at the menu screen suddenly that was the server crashing. If I was you though I would give this game at least 5 or 4 more days so the devs can fix the unstable servers.

NOTE:Before continuing this review take into factor my play time and also note that I have not gotten anywhere close to even the middle of the game play at the time you read this.

PROS.

1:Easy to learn mechanics for people who are not new to theses types of games.
2:A tech tree so everything isn't aviable at the very beginning
3:A tutorial (though poorly translated acording to some and broken for some like me).
4:A small but nice community so far though that is only for playing 3.5 hours on low populated servers.


CONS.
1:Problems with crafting items must be pressed 2 or more times to start crafting said item.
2:Research points are gained fairly slow and can make progressing very hard.
3:Multiple gathering actions must be activated twice or more before gathering is started.
4:Map and compass are extreamly confusing.
5:Low population on servers (though to some it is a good thing).
6:Only 2 server types beta (current) and alpha both as far as I know are the exact same.

EDIT:I recommend this for sure now because servers are now fixed after a couple of days seeing if they where unstable or they just haven't crashed on me yet so don't take my word for it. Anyway even though there are more cons then pros the cons are just small little things (expect for the research points being very slow to gain in fact I'm not even sure how to get them) I say give this game a shot if anything.

It's a great Minecraft-based conept, about going out and getting resouces in order to create, espand, and improve your base. The graphics are great, they don't look to bad.

It adds more to the fact of how I cannot recommend this game. Now of course, I wouldn't mind all of this of course, I mean, it is a free early access game. So it can't be that great. I do not often write reviews for games unless it absolutely warrants it. This game may not be for everyone but I recommend everyone to give it a try.

There are so many reasons for my recommedation including the community which is also big reason why I have rung up 150+ hours in under 9 days of playing this gem.  I usually avoid Early Access games and we all have our horror stories, but this game is growing with regular updates many of the communities requests/ideas actually being worked into the game.

The game is a mixture of, in my opinion, a real time strategy like Age of Empires and any crafting survival game with a growing economy. It is not a grafically extreme game though it is very smooth and well groomed and very easy to look at (for hours on end). The map in huge and there is plenty of days worth of walking to cover it. The battle system is good and reminiscent of turn-based JRPG and can be frustrating at first but after a few tries and some handy advice from the community, it becomes a lot easier. The crafting element is detailed and in-depth yet not so complicated as to leave confused or irritated. The amount of items you can craft is huge and as I mentioned before, is being added to constantly. The economy is easy to grasp and is community driven rather than a stardard set by the game. The trading system is growing with improvments only just recently made to the craftable shop and also easy to understand.

That being said, the chat community and Admins/Mods have been helpful from day one and my experience has been nothing less than excellent. My noob questions were answered without hate or trolling and have even been given items to help me start out.
